title: Food delivery via aggregators amounts to Rs 9,000-11,000 crore of additional costs annually: report
description: According to the report, food delivery aggregators charge an average premium of Rs 46 per dish compared to direct restaurant orders. Aggregators impose 150-200% higher delivery fees than some restaurants and charge Rs 2 more for packaging than restaurants, even though the packaging is the same.
content: Ordering food through delivery aggregators leads up to a steep Rs 9,000-11,000 crore of additional costs annually on average, a new report on the food delivery sector said.These costs include convenience fee over direct restaurant orders and include prices for delivery, packaging and subscription fees, the report, by marketing agency Mavericks India, noted.It said that premiums charged by large aggregators in India generate an overall additional cost of Rs 9,000-11,000 crore, with cumulative packaging premiums alone generating an annual cost of approximately Rs 400 crore.According to the report, food delivery aggregators charge an average premium of Rs 46 per dish compared to direct restaurant orders, aggregators impose 150-200% higher delivery fees compared to some restaurants, and charge Rs 2 for packaging than restaurants, even though the packaging is the same.The report said it analysed data from across Swiggy, Zomato and Magic Pin, on price inflation and hidden costs embedded in food aggregator services, including delivery fees, packaging charges, and the marginal utility of premium subscriptions like Zomato Gold. The data compared these with more transparent pricing on restaurant-owned delivery platforms and found significant disparities, according to the report.
